Hi Colin,

I've tried several activation functions, Sine was the one that p=
roduced the best results (for a single set of input data). It is defined in=
 the params.txt with that line:

SubstrateActivationFunction Sine

If there=
's no hard coded usage of any sigmoid activation function, then the constru=
ctor should be correct.

However, it doesn't work. The input is exactly the=
 same, the output completely different.

Cheers,
Daniel

--- In neat@yahoog=
roups.com, Colin Green <colin.green1@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> David is prob=
ably best placed to answer this one, but I was just
> wondering if the acti=
vation function being passed in the Substrate
> constructor is correct. Nor=
mally I think it would be one of the
> sigmoid activation functions; as a s=
ine function is normally used in
> the underlying CPPN/genome. Apart from t=
hat method 3 looks about
> right.
> 
> Colin
>
